questions.title: Question 2 for Class CLIMATE102_190906
questions.main: The main difference between a hurricane and a tropical storm is that:
questions.answer: C) winds speeds are greater in a hurricane

mcq.option: B) tropical storms are more than 500 miles from the US mainland
C) winds speeds are greater in a hurricane
D) hurricanes have a clearly defined eye on satellite photographs

questions.main: Which below only forms over water?

questions.title: Question 4 for Class CLIMATE102_190906
questions.main: How does a hurricane watch differ from a hurricane warning?
questions.answer: When a hurricane poses a direct threat to an area a hurricane watch is issued. When it appears that the storm will strike an area within 24 hours a hurricane warning is issued.

questions.title: Question 5 for Class CLIMATE102_190906
questions.main: Explain how global warming might influence the intensity and/or frequency of several extreme weather events.
questions.answer: It is likely that in the future there will be more summer heat waves with more record high temperatures.  Recent modeling studies indicate that there will be an increased risk of more extreme more frequent and longer-lasting heat waves.  The added water vapor in the air brings a risk of more intense precipitation events.  In areas where precipitation is likely to decrease more frequent and extreme drought is likely.

questions.title: Question 9 for Class CLIMATE102_190906
questions.answer: C) alpine glaciers grew in size and advanced

C) alpine glaciers grew in size and advanced
D) continental glaciers covered large portions of North America
E) sea level lowered by about 280 ft
